page.title: 18Law and Order-Norwich Prison
page.content: H.M.Prison,Norwich,stands in the south-west of the "D" block.Part of the complex occupies the former Britannia Barracks,once the home of the Royal Norfolk Regiment.This is an imposing redbrick building overlooking the city from the edge of Mousehold Heath. The prison is made up of several units which cover 43.2 acres,much of it hardly visible from nearby roads. The population fluctates around 630-650 inmates guarded by some 200 uniformed staff. The oldest part of the prison dates from 1887,and houses the Local Prison of men on remand.Their stay can last from a few weeks to several months and it is the Prison Service's duty to deliver the prisoners to local courts for trial and sentencing. Inside the Local Prison the men live
